title: Rocky Mountain Super Pass+ Expands Into the Last Frontier
text:
Rocky Mountain Super Pass+ Expands Into the Last Frontier RMSP+ Pass Holders Now Get Access to Alaska’s Alyeska Resort Alyeska Resort Published: July 31, 2015 
WINTER PARK, Colo. – Already known for featuring some of the best snow in Colorado, the Rocky Mountain Super Pass+ (RMSP+) now includes Alyeska Resort in Alaska. Located just 40 miles from Anchorage, Alyeska Resort boasts nearly 650 inches of annual snowfall and the longest continuous double black-diamond run in North America. This addition offers RMSP+ pass holders the opportunity to satisfy their sense of adventure with three days of skiing at the full-service resort and further amplifies the value of the RMSP+. 
The RMSP+ now covers five of Colorado’s most beloved resorts with skiing/riding at Intrawest’s Colorado destinations, Winter Park Resort and Steamboat, as well as Copper Mountain, Eldora, and Crested Butte, extends to Alaska with Alyeska, and provides international skiing with Mt. Ruapehu in New Zealand. With seven resorts now at their disposal, RMSP+ pass holders have access to over 11,000 globe-spanning acres of terrain. 
“We’re excited to give RMSP+ pass holders the unique opportunity to enjoy an experience that can only be found on the legendary slopes of Alyeska Resort,” said Matt Bowers, Intrawest Chief Marketing Officer. “For any skier, snowboarder, or lover of the outdoors, Alaska stands atop the list of places that must be visited, and now RMSP+ pass holders have a chance to appreciate first-hand the pristine, majestic beauty of our 49 th state and its finest destination ski resort.” 
The largest ski area in Alaska, Alyeska Resort features over 1,600 skiable acres and is known for its breath-taking steeps and deep snowpack. In addition to world-class skiing, the resort also has the Four-Star Hotel Alyeska, a 304-room luxury property with restaurant, shops, and spa services. 
As part of the new relationship, those who buy an Alyeska Resort season pass will get three total days that they can use at Copper Mountain, Steamboat, and Winter Park, giving Alyeska pass holders a chance to sample some of the best skiing Colorado has to offer. 
“Alyeska Resort is world-renowned for its incredible terrain, which makes an alliance with Winter Park, Steamboat, and Copper Mountain such a perfect fit,” remarked John Byrne III, owner of Alyeska Resort. “Now Alyeska Resort pass holders, who love Alaska’s most iconic resort, can experience three equally iconic Colorado destinations that are the ideal exemplification of both world-class terrain and guest amenities.” 
The RMSP+ is currently on sale for $559 for adults. For more information on all the benefits afforded to RMSP+ pass holders or to purchase, please visit www.skicolorado.com . 

ABOUT INTRAWEST RESORTS HOLDINGS, INC. Intrawest is a North American mountain resort and adventure company, delivering distinctive vacation and travel experiences to its customers for over three decades. The Company wholly owns six four-season mountain resorts with approximately 8,000 skiable acres and over 1,130 acres of land available for real estate development. Intrawest’s mountain resorts are geographically diversified across most of North America’s major ski regions, including the Eastern United States, the Rocky Mountains, and Canada. The Company also operates an adventure travel business, the cornerstone of which is Canadian Mountain Holidays, a leading heli-skiing adventure company in North America. Additionally, the Company operates a comprehensive real estate business through which it manages, markets and sells vacation club properties; manages condominium hotel properties; and sells and markets residential real estate. Intrawest Resorts Holdings, Inc. common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: SNOW). For more information, visit www.intrawest.com . 
ABOUT COPPER MOUNTAIN RESORT An easily navigable, pedestrian-friendly, true mountain village lies in the heart of this affordable, accessible Colorado resort. Located just 75 miles west of Denver off Interstate 70, Copper Mountain is a year-round mountain getaway offering a low-key, genuine feeling that is inclusive and comfortable for all. From unforgettable naturally divided skiing and riding in the winter highlighted by unique year-round action sport progression focused programming with Woodward Copper, to the perfect summer mountain temperature for hiking and mountain biking inclusive with dramatic views of the Rocky Mountain’s Ten Mile Range, Copper Mountain is quintessential Colorado. www.CopperColorado.com . 
ABOUT ALYESKA RESORT Alyeska Resort is Alaska's premier year-round destination featuring The Hotel Alyeska, an award-winning 302 room full-service property. Located just 40 miles from Anchorage and Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport, Alyeska Resort is your base camp for summer and winter excursions. Alyeska Resort stands out during ski season with 650” of average snowfall annually and the longest-continuous double black diamond ski run in North America. Learn more about the resort and plan your Alaskan adventure at www.AlyeskaResort.com or 800-880-3880.
